org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class RunSystemCommand

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.RunSystemCommand

public class RunSystemCommand
extends Object

The class RunSystemCommand is a utility class that provides methods to run a specified system command and grab the output and error from the system command and store it in strings that can be retrieved

Written:

Copyright (C) 2001, The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR).

All rights reserved.

Anup Mahurkar

runCommand

public int runCommand(String scriptName,
                      boolean isStdoutSpecified,
                      boolean isStderrSpecified)
               throws Throwable
The runCommand method executes the specified script or executable program. The scriptshould be have a fully qualified path or can be found in the path

Parameters:
scriptName - a String value for the script name or executable name
isStdoutSpecified - true if the underlying program is redirecting its own standard output
isStderrSpecified - true if the underlying program is redirecting its own standard error
Returns:
an int value of 0 if the script retruns 0, otherwise returns the return value of the script
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the execution thread is interrupted
IOException - if an error occurs creating the process to run the script, or an error occurs writing to the error or output streams
RuntimeException - if the the return value is not zero
Throwable - some other exception

runCommand

public int runCommand(String[] cmdsArray,
                      boolean isStdoutSpecified,
                      boolean isStderrSpecified,
                      String stdoutFile,
                      String stderrFile)
               throws Throwable
The runCommand method executes the specified script or executable program. The scriptshould be have a fully qualified path or can be found in the path

Parameters:
scriptName - a String value for the script name or executable name
isStdoutSpecified - true if the underlying program is redirecting its own standard output (overrides stdoutFile)
isStderrSpecified - true if the underlying program is redirecting its own standard error (overrides stderrFile)
stdoutFile - a String representing the standard out file name
stderrFile - a String representing the standard error file name
Returns:
an int value of 0 if the script retruns 0, otherwise returns the return value of the script
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the execution thread is interrupted
IOException - if an error occurs creating the process to run the script, or an error occurs writing to the error or output streams
RuntimeException - if the the return value is not zero
Throwable - some other exception

runCommand

public int runCommand(String scriptName)
               throws Throwable
The method runCommand executes the specified command and grabs the standard out and standard error streams by default by launching separate threads to read the streams.

Parameters:
scriptName -
Returns:
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the execution thread is interrupted
IOException - if an error occurs creating the process to run the script, or an error occurs writing to the error or output streams
RuntimeException - if the the return value is not zero
Throwable - some other exception

                      String stdoutFile,
                      String stderrFile)
               throws InterruptedException,
                      IOException,
                      RuntimeException,

The method runCommand executes the specified command and redirects the stdout and stderr to the specified files.

Parameters:
